metadata.title: CVE-2015-20107 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In Python (aka CPython) up to 3.10.8, the mailcap module does not addescape characters into commands discovered in the system mailcap file. Thismay allow attackers to inject shell commands into applications that callmailcap.findmatch with untrusted input (if they lack validation ofuser-provided filenames or arguments). The fix is also back-ported to 3.7,3.8, 3.9

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-20107` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm2
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm2
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm2
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm2
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm2
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm2
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm2
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm3
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm3
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm3
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm3
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm3
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm3
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm3
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm3
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.18+esm2').
python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm3').
